headline: Bill Ray, 83, Photographer Of Indelible Moments
abstract: He captured Marilyn Monroe singing “Happy birthday, Mr. President,” Elvis Presley as an Army private, scenes of war and urban unrest, and much more.
lead_paragraph: Bill Ray, one of the last staff photographers for the weekly Life magazine, who shot images as breathtaking as Marilyn Monroe singing “Happy Birthday” to President John F. Kennedy and as indelible as a Navy cruiser’s guns firing on the Vietcong, died on Jan. 9 at his home in Manhattan. He was 83.
